chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall x y : Z, rel_prime x y -> rel_prime (Z.opp x) (Z.opp y)

Premises:
Decimal.opp = fun d : Decimal.int => match d with | Decimal.Pos d0 => Decimal.Neg d0 | Decimal.Neg d0 => Decimal.Pos d0 end : Decimal.int -> Decimal.int Arguments Decimal.opp _%dec_int_scope
rel_prime = fun a b : Z => Zis_gcd a b 1 : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments rel_prime (_ _)%Z_scope
Inductive Z : Set := Z0 : Z | Zpos : positive -> Z | Zneg : positive -> Z Arguments Zpos _%positive_scope Arguments Zneg _%positive_scope
not_rel_prime2 : forall x y d : Z, (d | x) -> (d | y) -> d <> 1 -> d <> -1 -> ~ rel_prime x y
rel_prime_sym : forall x y : Z, rel_prime x y -> rel_prime y x
not_rel_prime1 : forall x y : Z, ~ rel_prime x y -> exists d : Z, Zis_gcd x y d /\ d <> 1 /\ d <> -1
rel_prime_dec : forall x y : Z, {rel_prime x y} + {~ rel_prime x y}
gcd_rel_prime : forall x y d : Z, Zis_gcd x y d -> exists a b : Z, x = d * a /\ y = d * b /\ rel_prime a b
OMEGA6 : forall x y z : Z, 0 <= x -> y = 0 -> 0 <= x + y * z
ZMicromega.le_0_iff : forall x y : Z, x <= y < -> 0 <= y - x
OMEGA9 : forall x y z t : Z, y = 0 -> x = z -> y + (- x + z) * t = 0
Zgcd_spec : forall x y : Z, {z : Z | Zis_gcd x y z /\ 0 <= z}
fast_Zopp_plus_distr : forall (x y : Z) (P : Z -> Prop), P (- x + - y) -> P (- (x + y))
Z_lt_dec : forall x y : Z, {x < y} + {~ x < y}
Z.divide = fun x y : Z => exists z : Z, y = z * x : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.divide (_ _)%Z_scope
Z.lt = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y) = Lt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
Z.le = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y) <> Gt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
Z.gt = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y) = Gt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.gt (_ _)%Z_scope
Z.ge = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y) <> Lt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.ge (_ _)%Z_scope
fast_Zred_factor5 : forall (x y : Z) (P : Z -> Prop), P y -> P (x * 0 + y)
Z.eq_dec : forall x y : Z, {x = y} + {x <> y}
Z.Even_wd = fun (x y : Z) (H : x = y) => Morphisms.trans_co_eq_inv_impl_morphism RelationClasses.iff_Transitive (exists m : Z, x = 2 * m) (exists m : Z, y = 2 * m) (Morphisms_Prop.ex_iff_morphism (fun m : Z => x = 2 * m) (fun m : Z => y = 2 * m) (fun m : Z => Morphisms.PER_morphism (RelationClasses.Equivalence_PER Z.eq_equiv) x y H (2 * m) (2 * m) (Morphisms.reflexive_proper_proxy RelationClasses.Equivalence_Reflexive (2 * m)))) (exists m : Z, y = 2 * m) (exists m : Z, y = 2 * m) (Morphisms.eq_proper_proxy (exists m : Z, y = 2 * m)) (RelationClasses.reflexivity (exists m : Z, y = 2 * m)) :...
Z.Proper_instance_0 = fun (x y : Z) (H : x = y) (x0 y0 : Z) (H0 : x0 = y0) => conj (fun H1 : x <= x0 => Z.Private_Tac.not_gt_le (fun H2 : y0 < y => (fun H3 : x <= y0 => (fun H4 : y <= y0 => (fun H5 : y < y => Z.Private_Tac.lt_irrefl H5) (Z.Private_Tac.le_lt_trans H4 H2)) (Z.Private_Tac.eq_le (Z.Private_Tac.eq_sym H) H3)) (Z.Private_Tac.le_eq H1 H0))) (fun H1 : y <= y0 => Z.Private_Tac.not_gt_le (fun H2 : x0 < x => (fun H3 : y0 < x => (fun H4 : y0 < y => (fun H5 : y < y => Z.Private_Tac.lt_irrefl H5) (Z.Private_T...
natlike_rec : forall P : Z -> Set, P 0 -> (forall x : Z, 0 <= x -> P x -> P (Z.succ x)) -> forall x : Z, 0 <= x -> P x
Zeq_bool = fun x y : Z => match x ?= y with | Eq => true | _ => false end : Z -> Z -> bool Arguments Zeq_bool (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.pow = fun x y : Z => match y with | 0 => 1 | Z.pos p => BinIntDef.Z.pow_pos x p | Z.neg _ => 0 end : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.pow (_ _)%Z_scope
ZMicromega.le_neg : forall x : Z, (0 <= x -> False) < -> 0 < - x
fast_Zopp_mult_distr_r : forall (x y : Z) (P : Z -> Prop), P (x * - y) -> P (- (x * y))
rel_prime_mult : forall a b c : Z, rel_prime a b -> rel_prime a c -> rel_prime a (b * c)
Znumtheory.rel_prime_sym : forall a b : Z, rel_prime a b -> rel_prime b a
BinIntDef.Z.add = fun x y : Z => match x with | 0 => y | Z.pos x' => match y with | 0 => x | Z.pos y' => Z.pos (x' + y') | Z.neg y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub x' y' end | Z.neg x' => match y with | 0 => x | Z.pos y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub y' x' | Z.neg y' => Z.neg (x' + y') end end : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.add (_ _)%Z_scope
rel_prime_div : forall p q r : Z, rel_prime p q -> (r | p) -> rel_prime r q
relp_mult3 : forall a b c : Z, rel_prime (a * b) c -> rel_prime a c
